nodes.name: “Pobai” Antiaris toxicaria
nodes.description: A tall deciduous tree known for its toxic latex. Found in tropical forests and used in traditional medicine.

nodes.name: “Si Siet Thet” Sappanwood
nodes.description: A medicinal shrub used for red dye and herbal remedies. Common in Southeast Asia.

nodes.name: “Waa” Java Plum
nodes.description: Evergreen tropical tree bearing edible purple fruits. Widely cultivated in Asia.

nodes.name: “Yang Sian” Dipterocarpus tuberculatus
nodes.description: A large dipterocarp tree native to Southeast Asian forests. Important for timber and resin.

nodes.name: “Por Hu Chang” Hibiscus macrophyllus
nodes.description: A broad-leaved shrub native to Thai forests, with medicinal uses.

nodes.name: “Sai” Banyan Tree
nodes.description: A majestic fig tree with aerial roots. Considered sacred in many cultures.

nodes.name: “Luead Kwai” Bischofia javanica
nodes.description: Fast-growing tree with reddish wood. Often found in tropical lowland forests.

nodes.name: “Tao Ngu Hao” Aristolochia tagala
nodes.description: A climbing vine known for its snake-like flower patterns. Used in traditional remedies.

nodes.name: “Champi Pa” Wild Champak
nodes.description: A forest magnolia with fragrant white flowers. Native to mountainous forest zones.

nodes.name: “Yam Hom” Wild Ylang-Ylang
nodes.description: Aromatic tree with flowers used in perfumes and oils.

nodes.name: “Kaprao Pa” Wild Holy Basil
nodes.description: A wild form of basil with strong aroma and medicinal properties.

nodes.name: “Kritsana” Eaglewood
nodes.description: Valuable tree known for producing agarwood, used in incense and perfumes.

nodes.name: “Nonn Khi Kwai” Acalypha wilkesiana
nodes.description: A colorful-leaved ornamental shrub, used in hedges and landscaping.

nodes.name: Shorea roxburghii
nodes.description: A high-value timber tree found in dry dipterocarp forests.

nodes.name: “Ya Kha” Cogon Grass
nodes.description: A tough perennial grass common in disturbed forest areas. Used for thatching and erosion control.
